isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - BEGINNING THE TROUBLESHOOTING PROCESS

important.para: Review BEFORE BEGINNING TROUBLESHOOTING located above.

step1.para: When beginning the troubleshooting process, check for diagnostic codes using the TransPro diagnostic software.
Record all information relating to the logged diagnostic codes.
Test drive vehicle to confirm code or performance complaint.

step2.para: If the code is active after the test drive, refer to the appropriate Allison service manual for the appropriate test procedure.

If the code is not "active" after the test drive, it may have been a momentary problem. Note the number of occurrences for the code. If the number of occurrences indicates that the code has been registered several times, perform the diagnostics for the diagnostic code and concentrate on problem areas that could create an intermittent condition.
